_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Four ways that negate the spiritual life: The first way that negates the spiritual life
The second way that negates the spiritual life
The third way that negates the spiritual life
The fourth way that negates the spiritual life
Four kinds of unreliable spiritual life: A certain teacher who claims to be all-knowing and all-seeing
A certain teacher who claims to have supernormal powers
A certain teacher who claims to be a Buddha
A certain teacher who claims to be a fully awakened Buddha
The four kinds of unreliable spiritual l: The first kind of unreliable spiritual life
The second kind of unreliable spiritual life
The third kind of unreliable spiritual life
The fourth kind of unreliable spiritual life
The procedure of the skillful teaching [: A Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha
They give up the five hindrances
They enter and remain in the first absorption
They enter and remain in the second absorption
They enter and remain in the third absorption
They enter and remain in the fourth absorption
They extend their mind toward recollection of past lives
They extend their mind toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings
They extend their mind toward knowledge of the ending of defilements
The five transgressions (a causal chain): Deliberately taking the life of a living creature
Taking something with the intention to steal
Storing up goods for their own enjoyment like they did as a lay person.
